page.title: 09COATES: A FENLAND VILLAGE
page.content: Coates is a village of some 800 inhabitants situated 12 miles from the City of Peterborough. It is entirely surrounded by a flat sea of arable farm land. The village is built around a village green which has been cut in half by the A605 road. Some of the older houses are thatched, and all are built of local brick. The village has 2 pubs, a village shop, a post office, a garage, a used car showroom, a pet shop and an agricultural engineers. 10 years ago 100 new houses were built in a small estate. These have been brought by newcomers to the area. A Parish church, a Methodist Chapel, and a village hall complete the amenities. The Primary school caters for children from 4 to 11 years, of which there are about 140.
